name: Boca Raton Marriott at Boca Center

reviews.text: I stayed here on a Sunday night for one night. I paid $179 for a Concierge Level room that included breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Bit Far From Beach

likes.disliked: — Not across the street from the beach.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: The lobby is clean, bright and upscale, very nicely decorated in a modern decor with a nice center fountain. Right when I arrived to checkin the bellhop immediately asked if I need help with my bags. I found the front desk very helpful too. They gave me printed out index cards with directions to Delrey and Deerfield beaches, both within a 15-30 minute car ride. The hotel itself is about 8 miles inland so it's just a short drive to the beach.

I had a room on the 11th floor facing the front of the hotel which has a better view than the back which overlooks some smaller building rooftops. You can't see the ocean as the hotel is too far. I was told all rooms in the hotel are identical. The room is very modern, with a bright red couch, yellow table, and yellow curtains with geometric patterns. I think this hotel is in the middle of a renovation or upgrades, as some rooms on my floor had signs on the doors that said Wet Paint. The ceilings however still are popcorn ceilings. Overall, the room made me feel very cheery!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Convenient to All

reviews.text: The bathrooms was very clean and appointed with Bath and Body Works essentials. I liked that the shower curtain rod curved out so that the curtain doesn't stick to you. The shower and toilet are separated by a door to the sink and closet so that two people can get ready at once if need be.
reviews.title: Hotel finished, staff needs renovation

reviews.text: I had a Concierge Level reservation so I had access to the nightly snacks and morning breakfast on Floor 3, however I never got a chance to attend either. The 11/12th floors, Concierge Levels, also had the latest Newsweek on the elevator counter. Nice touch. They deliver the NY Times to your doorstep in the morning too.
reviews.title: Getting There...Will Be Great When It Is Finished

reviews.text: I stayed 4 nights at this hotel for a business conference. The good is that its located near a great mall which is almost walking distance althought I'd recommend driving, near the major highways and self-park is free. Another nice thing about the hotel is that its located in the back of a high-end strip mall that has a few good restaurants there are literally a 10-20 second walk from the back door of the hotel. Also about a 60 second walk from the hotel is a starbucks for morning coffee.
reviews.title: Not super luxurious, but not bad either

reviews.text: The hotel is staffed with very friendly people and the hotel lobby is fairly nice. The rooms however lack any uniquness or luxury to them. They are very stereo-typical rooms for this property vendor. They are clean however. The bathroom is very plain, well, the whole room is sorta plain. They do give you a couch and the beds were comfortable, for a hotel. The windows on my 8th floor room were actually sliding glass doors with no balcony, yet didnt open either. One of my biggest complaints about hotels these days are the noises from the hallways and other rooms and I found it to be quiet. So decent soundproofing in this hotel. Also, the wi-fi internet was free and I had thought I read on the website that it wasn't.
reviews.title: Very convenient and efficient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price I paid in excess for two hundred dollars, I probably could have done better. I would recommend someone to this hotel if they are looking for a place to stay in the Boca area, especially for business. If you are seeking luxury accomodations, I'd send you somewhere else.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: This is not necessarily the hotel to stay at if looking for a beach vacation, but is was extremely convenient for our purposes. The rooms are very comfortable, although the bathroom/dressing area is a bit cramped for two people. The hotel staff was responsive and accommodating. If not looking to be on the beach, then this is a great location. Close to the major roads and adjacent to a very convenient shopping center. Good variety of food and conveniences in walking distance.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: I must say that whoever is managing this particular property is doing an excellent job. I believe that service starts from the top on down. Every single person we came into contact with was friendly and helpful---from the minute we pulled into driveway.
reviews.title: The Best Place To Stay in Boca!
Nice Hotel !
reviews.text: This hotel has been completely renovated and is the best in Boca, as they just finished a total hotel renovation, and everything looks so nice. The guestrooms are awesome, and being attached to many shops, dining, and entertainment, I will surely come back to this hotel. The staff is truly hospitable as well.

The Marriott Boca Raton is in the final stage of a renovation. Our room was new and well designed. The location is quite good with several restaurants near by. Above average gym and nice pool too. The executive lounge was worth paying $20.00 per day when we checked in.
reviews.title: Nice Renovated Hotel

reviews.text: There is also a Legal Seafoods restaurant over at the larger mall (10-15 minute walk from the hotel).
reviews.title: Great Deal Off Hotwire
Nice Hotel!!!
reviews.text: The hotel is very nice. Staff extremely friendly. Wonderful Concierge.

Hotel is an older Marriott, but the linens are fairly new and room also includes flat screen tv and mini fridge. Bathroom is larger then the normal Marriott bathrooms. Sink is separate from the tub/toilet. Dont have to scrunch in to shut the door.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Furniture is the older but the mattress and springs were new and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent Accomodations with Superior Service

reviews.text: A variety of restaurants in walking distance and across the street at the Town Center Mall.
reviews.title: The best

reviews.text: I booked through hotwire for a nice hotel in Boca Raton. I was not disappointed. The Marriott is not near the beach, which is too bad considering the beauty of Boca Raton beaches. Apart from that, this hotel is very good value: spacious rooms, very nice pool and gym, professional staff. Nothing exceptional or charming, but a decent, no-worries place to stay in one of my favorite beach cities in Florida. Internet is free, so is parking which is always nice when you compare with the major amount of money you have to spend for these commodities in so-called premium hotels like Mandarin Oriental.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, with friendly service. Wonderful room. Suprisingly good gym. Adequate pool facilities. Fresh fruit at gym and pool everyday and free coffee and beverages. My only complaint that was when I booked this hotel on line it said continental breakfast. I assumed it meant continental breakfast was included free. It was not. It was a bit misleading. Oh, and when you ask for extra towels on line, they do give you extra towels the first night, but you have to ask daily or you will not continually get them. Overall, though, it was a very good hotel.
reviews.title: Suprising good hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We opted to stay at this hotel after 2 previous comfortable stays here, albeit a few years ago. The desk staff were helpful and courteous but the stay was marred by terrible restaurant. We had breakfast included, it was in a word "disgusting". The porridge was like wallpaper paste, the potatoes tasted like they had been reheated at least twice, finally the skimmed milk which we were about to pour over our cereal actually came out in lumps!!! This really put into question the state of cleanliness and management of the kitchen. One of the waiters stood by our table, with his arms crossed the entire time, asking if we wanted tea or coffee!! This isn't the customer service one expects and usually get from the Marriott. The guy in charge of the restaurant one morning, tried to force his way by me with a chair, it was obvious there was not room, but he persisted until I had to move - in the middle of breakfast. All very odd!!! It seemed to me that the recession we are all experiencing has hit the Marriott at Boca Town Centre .......... The room was also set up with a tv directly on the wall to the right, and just ahead of the bed, I don't know about everyone else but when in a hotel I like to watch film, news etc usually from the comfort of my bed.....which was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Very disappointing
very good management
reviews.text: My husband and I have been at the Boca Raton Marriott in Boca Center during 2 days at the beginning of our trip to Florida. We consider Marriott to be a very reliable chain, and this stay confirmed it. Check-in was simple and fast, and we were allowed into the room even though we arrived well ahead of check-in time (we were travelling from Brazil and came directly from Miami airport). The room was quite large, with a comfortable king bed, a sofa, a large desk, a coffee table, and a beautiful view. Breakfast had a good choice of options. Location is good and close to several stores, particularly to the Town Center at Boca Raton, a very good shopping mall. The only problem we had during our stay was caused by a noisy family next room (there was a connecting door). I complained about it to the reception and they immediately phoned the room and returned to me to say that they hoped everything would be fine from then on. The day before our departure, management called me and asked about our stay and whether we had had any problems. I think this is a very professional attitude that, at the same time, adds a personal touch. Checkout was fast and simple. In short, a pleasant stay at a nice hotel, as is usually the case with Marriotts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel would have been fine if the rooms were not heavily deodorized. Must be because none of the windows opened. I couldn't stay here again because of the perfume-y smell in the room.
reviews.title: One problem keeps me from coming back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few other comments--although a duvet is very nice, and glad that Marriott is going that way--it was a really heavy comforter for Florida. Couldn't quite get the temperature and the heaviness of the duvet in sync.
reviews.title: Very Welcomng

reviews.text: Stayed here for the weekend. Pros: Nice area with lots of shops, restaurants, and offices within walking distance. Especially liked late dinner at Roco Tacos. Lots of free parking in close proximity to the doors (no need to pay for valet). Nice large pool area and modern fitness center. Free wireless. Interesting flavors of water (cucumber, lime, etc.) free in lobby daily.
reviews.title: Just ok but convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Cell phone went missing after housekeeping was in our room. Search of room found some suprising things under the bed from previous guests so cleanliness was called into question. On site food was expensive but lots of nearby alternatives. Bar in pool area was marginally stocked one day and didn't open on the other day of a weekend despite nice weather. Front desk denied late checkout request for half our party and we noticed denied rooms sat untouched by housekeeping for entire period of the late checkout request. Our beds were fine but others in our party had extremely soft beds.
reviews.title: This is the worst supposedly 4-star hotel we have experienced anywhere in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had requested a room on a high floor, they sent us to the second floor. The room looked tired, shabby and dated. The bathroom area was very cramped, no fan. Toiletries were skimpy, towels not great qualitiy. The front desk personell were friendly but very slow. We needed a copy, the copier was not working. Needed to send a fax, had problems with that machine also. My husband tried to use the lobby restroom, out of toilet paper.
reviews.title: The best - couldn't ask for more.

reviews.text: At breakfast we made the mistake to order a-la-carte. It took forever to get our meal.
reviews.title: Fab, loved the hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The eggs and potatoes were fine, but attempts to cut the steak with a knife failed. Prying into the meat disclosed grissle throughout. I did not eat it.
reviews.title: Needs a Major Renovation

aka: Boca Raton Marriott At Boca Hotel
